summary: The Department of Defense has made significant use of private security contractors in the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq. Contractors' involvement in the deaths of civilians and other incidents prompted a renewed call in 2008 for nations to ensure that contractors respect international humanitarian law. DOD has worked to improve its monitoring of its security contractor use but can't readily or comprehensively identify these personnel...
title: Private Security Contractors: DOD Needs to Better Identify and Monitor Personnel and Contracts
